title: WILD NFT
description: 自然環境をサポートするNFTは未発達。自然環境や動物の保護を支援するNFTには大きなチャンスがあります。

media.title: How NFTs are building the internet of the future

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement clearly defined, however it lacks evidence of the market value or size of wild life fundraising campaigns or similar to identify the potential number of users that could be affected.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal fails to suitable define the link impact and benefit to the environment ie: How will the project be implemented to benefit the environment/project as well as the Cardano ecosystem?
The technical experience of the project team is well grounded, including development experience in the Cardano ecosystem.
In my opinion the project is likely to be implemented successfully, however approval would be require submission of additional information to support the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap and budget seem reasonable but would require further justification based on jurisdiction as costs may vary considerably based on location. Key deliverable are well laid out but fail to clearly define KPI's. Example below;
After 6 months:
• Stable & growing userbase; Is stable growth defined by 100 or 1000 new users? What is the target user growth?
• Participating in, and benefiting from, the growing wave of support to mitigate climate change by investing in our environment What is the target investment at this point?
• Specialized regional and topic pages; Which regions will be first at timeline?
• Partnerships with companies & non-profit corporations Target number of partnerships ?
The risks and opportunities have not been defined in the proposal and it unclear whether these have been considered.
In my opinion I neither  agree or disagree that the proposal provides sufficient information for the proposal to progress and be suitable for funding due to the lack of clearly defined region of set up or KPIs

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement is presented in a reasonable and clear way, and in alignment with the challenge brief. Currently, there are numerous NFT markets but not many have been emphasizing use cases outside of the art aspect. Even fewer have decided to focus on the support and wellbeing of animals and environment, making (in my opinion) the direction of the proposal attractive and a unique contribution to the Cardano ecosystem.  From my understanding, the proposal has the potential and intention to work both on a local and global level, inviting both organizations, community members and retail investors for involvement in the project. The proposers does not exactly describe exactly how the creation of this NFT minting and market platform will counteract the initial problem, but the intention is described further down in the proposal. The scale of the proposal is massive, which may explain the substantial amount of funding. 
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The 7 team members cover an impressive area of complimentary expertise and experience in the field related to the proposal. Both from the perspective of being active members and contributors to the Cardano ecosystem, and having decades of experience with working in the field of environmental development and animal rights. Sufficient information on each team member is provided through their respective LinkedIn profiles. Having already gone through the process of creating a functioning platform (DignifID) is increasing the trustworthiness and credibility of the team. 
As stated before, the budget is rather substantial being 44% of the total budget for the challenge, but it makes sense considering that the proposer wants to launch an NFT minting tool AND market exchange portals within the time frame of 3 months (More on that later). The allocations of the budget is presented in a clear way, and the fact that their previously created platform (DignifID) is helping to cover the costs of the launch leads me to believe that the team has planned for sudden changes in the budget allocation. 

The 1 year-project plan is laid out in a clear and structured way, but I would have liked to see more detailed information about the different stages in the plan. The proposal does not say if the minting tool and market exchange has been developed already, or will be created from scratch from the time of potential budget allocation. This makes a huge difference in my opinion, since creating functioning tools and a working platform in 90 days is a very short time frame depending on where you start from. Adding information about where the process of creating the platform and tool currently is would make it easier to assess the feasibility of the proposal. 
Another aspect that would have been beneficial for the proposal is an example of who the 'credible auditors that provide trusted and reliable financial support' is, are they organizations or private actors? How does the outreach look like? The proposal does give a hint of ongoing contracts with associated actors through their previous platform (DignifID), but it is unclear if they aim to use their connections from before or are in need of a completely new base of connections. 

Depending on how far they have come in the development of their platform and minting tool, I agree that this proposal will be implanted successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
Although a proper roadmap is not provided, the details of the project plan provides information on goals to be achieved within certain timeframes (3 months, 6 months, 12 months). In order to increase the audibility, the proposer could have added some KPIs and metrics that would help people outside of the organization to better understand if the milestones are achieved or not. For example, how many users does the project expect to host after 6 months? How much of the NFT revenue is allocated into the protection of animals and the environment, and what is the expected traffic after 3, 6 and 12 months of uptime? Is it concentrated on global spread right away or is there a plan for extending or developing from a few local areas/organizations?  I believe that answering these questions would invite the community to audit the growth process more clearly. 
In order to further increase the trustworthiness and credibility of the team and proposal, I would have liked to see a list of potential risks and challenges. From my understanding of the NFT-space, it is full of organizations and artists minting animal-themed NFTs. How do the proposer plan to emphasize their underlying USP (environment and animal wellbeing) as much as possible, in order to separate themselves from 'Bored apes' or 'Stoner animals'? There is a whole lot of potential in the idea and values behind this project, and I would've liked to see examples of how this project would emphasize the strong mission behind the product. Overall, I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating a platform to mint and sell NFTs to fund conservation addresses the challenge brief of creating business models with NFT's at the core. Minting and selling NFTs on the platform will increase the use and number of NFTs on Cardano, thus increasing utility and providing value to the ecosystem. I would like the team to refine the problem statement and solution (Problem - wildlife conservation requires funding. Solution - Mint and sell NFTs on our platform to fund conservation.)
f6_assessments.q1: Using NFTs to fund conservation is a good idea. Althhough links to LinkedIn for the team was profided, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. The team can further expand on the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal, what are the responsibilities and deliverables of each member. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed". I would like the team to expand on the go to market strategy to attract buyers to the platform.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a minimal roadmap and budget. I would like to see the team develop Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) (eg Mint 5000 NFTs by month 2, move $500,000 of value through the platform by month 6) for the project based on a monthly timetable and connect the KPIs to milestones on the project roadmap (timeline). I would like to see the team create a solid roadmap -  develop and add milestones to provide deeper detail, set technical development milestones for creating the product. I would like to see the budget developed beyond single line entries and broken down into monthly spending, and I would like the team to connect the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the spending, what are the specific tasks and deliverables that the developers must provide and when must they deliver the tasks – this breakdown will give a clearer indication about the implementation workload feasibility and match the deliverables to the spending - thus the team can track performance and spending over a timeline. As the project stands at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal falls within the scope of the challenge as the intention is to utilise NFTs, more specifically, a minting and market platform that delivers wellbeing and sustainability for natural environments and animals. The project aims to be platform of choice for investment into the natural environment and has the ability to be far reaching by being multilingual drawing investors to both a good cause and the Cardano ecosystem. Initial Wild NFT projects include a focus on natural environmental and wild animal conservation, together with a focus on the domestic pets. The latter provides for projects designed to fund shelter animals and care for pets whose aging owners are no longer able to do so. I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is comprised of 7 members each of which an expert in their respective fields brining collectively 85+ years of experience to the project. The technical team are well known and established in the Cardano community through their work in the NFT space. The project breaks down a total budget of $88k from project build to market, important to note here that 67% of the costs associated with he minting platform and market exchange interface will be provided by the DignifID Animal Foundation. The team further sets out a detailed roadmap with check points at month three, six and twelve which maps out an operational project after 3 months which in turn develops and expands from there. Given the technically sound team and collective experience of the team, together with the commitment by DignifID, it is highly likely that this project will be developed and integrated successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The team defines clear measurable deliverables which provides us with sufficient information to audit the progress and implementation of the project. The first fundamental deliverable being a working minting and multilingual marketplace platform in three months from which the project then flows. The team does not highlight and key risks or challenges associated with the project, which is something the team may wish to consider. That being said I agree there is sufficient information to measure the success of this project. I wish the team all the very best with this initiative.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge asks how we can use NFT for non-art business models. This proposal aims to create NFTs for the animal and environmental well being space. I think this high level idea of this proposal fits in nicely with the challenge.

I think the problem statement is poorly constructed. The problem statement is phrased a there being a "huge opportunity" in building some new tech but it's not clear who/what suffers from the lack of infrastructure in this space. To give an example, compare the following problem statements "millions of dollars worth of ADA are lost from giveaway scams" vs "antiscam infrastructure is underdeveloped and there's a huge opportunity in that space". Notice that the first framing is observes the problem more directly.

I think the solution statement is well crafted and gives readers a great sense of what this proposal aims to create if funded. 

I'm of the opinion that this project will have significant impact on the Cardano ecosystem because it is innovating that NFT tech in other ecosystems isn't. 

I believe that this solution will be scalable because it's very software oriented. The web app for minting NFTs I guess won't be particularly difficult to build since there's lots of prior work to be inspired by (I have a background as en engineer myself) and the decentralized exchange will be able to run even in times of high load because of it's decentralized nature.

The metrics and goals of the proposal align well with the requirements of the challenge. The proposal aims to increase NFT usage on the Cardano blockchain by enabling institutions to issue NFTs in support of animal and environmental well being. The proposal also aims to build this software in a multilingual way which will increase global adoption.

Overall I give this proposal a score of 5 for impact.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have a background in software myself and I think the plan, as it's currently laid out, is quite ambitious and unlikely to succeed on the proposed timeline. Now, it's very possible that I'm underestimating the speed the engineering team can build but I've worked on fairly talented teams (like distributed database teams at Facebook) and I think for even talented teams this is a lot of work to get done in a short amount of time.

One very positive signal is the professional experience of the team. They cumulatively have decades of experience and they have successfully provided links to their LinkedIn profiles. I would like to see links to Github profiles of the software-oriented team members to further validate the technical abilities of the team. 

Within 3 months the team wants to design and build an NFT minting platform with some social capabilities (like following providers) adn multi-lingual (internationlization) features. They also want to design and build a smart-contract supporting DEX for NFT exchange that's also internationalized on a completely new smart contract system (eUTxO). On top of both of these, they need to build a provider verification system which is no easy feat. In my professional opinion, these products will take 6-12 months to design and build with the desired feature set.

One of the 6 month milestones is "cashflow positive" but it's not clear how this product will generate cash. I have an intuition for how it will work but they haven't defined a business plan (will the NFT minting platform take a cut of all transactions? if so, how much?).

Overall I think the feasibility of this proposal executing as laid out is quite low and I disagree that it's highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal has done a good job of laying out milestones and deliverables at the 3, 6 and 12 month mark. 

Many of the 3 month milestones are easy to audit. The community can easily determine whether the NFT minting website and decentralized exchange are up and running.

However, it's very hard to audit the 6 month milestones. What does "stable and growing user base mean"? How is "stable" measured? What rate of growth is acceptable? How many "Specialized regional and topic pages" will there be? For which regions? For which topics? In my opinion, the milestones for the 6 month mark need to be more numeric, eg: "user base growing at 6% MoM". 

Interestingly, I don't see numeric metrics on how many NFTs are minted and (re)sold on the platform. Will just 1 sale count as a success? 100? 1000? 

Overall, I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals because a few of the goals/milestones are verifiable while many are unclear and unverifiable.

solution: WILD NFTは、自然環境や動物たちにウェルビーイングとサステナビリティを提供するワールドクラスのNFT鋳造・市場プラットフォームです。
experience: 私たちは、動物と環境のウェルビーイングをサポートするためのデジタルIDを提供する非営利団体、dignifid.orgを設立しました。NFT Maker Proは私たちの技術パートナーです。
